| **Date** | **Sign** |
| Site standards Procedure | Is Site standards procedure easily available on the electronic and hard copy format? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Review the header - is it the latest revision, check that the dates and signatures are present on the hard copy Is it a controlled copy? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 4.1 External standards | Is consideration given to activities and environment around plant that could have a negative impact on the quality of finished product? Are measures taken to prevent contamination of product? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are factory exteriors tidy?  Are grounds within the factory premises in good condition? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is natural drainage sufficient? If natural drainage is insufficient, has a suitable drainage system been installed?  Are drains protected to avoid entry of pests? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is the Building fabric maintained to minimize potential for product contamination by pest entry and ingress of water or contaminants? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are External traffic routes, under site control, suitably surfaced to avoid contamination of product? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Exterior loading and unloading areas are maintained to minimize hazards? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| External and internal storage of refuse/waste in designated areas?  Are outside garbage receptacles and dumpsters kept covered or closed**?** |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Fire Exit Door unobstructed on the outside i.e.. No car parked against it? Or smoking but bins blocking.? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 4.2 Building fabric and interiors: Raw material handling, preparation, processing, packing and storage areas | Walls in good condition?  Are exterior walls free of holes to exclude pests? Are pipes vents, air ducts designed and protected in order to prevent pest entry e.g. by using fine mesh? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are interior walls and ceilings free of cracks and crevices to prevent insect’s harborage and allow proper sanitation? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| No evidence of peeling or flaking paint in production areas?  Any dust on walls, pipes? Cobwebs? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are floor surfaces in good condition, with no standing water, no debris trapping cracks and are easy to clean? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Drains clean? Internal drain openings suitably protected against entry of pests and odour? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is an 18”(46 cm) internal wall perimeter being maintained within the facility, with adequate access to these wall perimeters thereby allowing inspection and cleaning? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Structural Beams - No peeling / flaking paint and dust free |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Are windows that constitute a risk of contamination to product protected against breakage? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are light bulbs, including insect trap lights, shatterproof or protected against breakage to prevent product contamination? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is there suitable and adequate lighting in the production and storage areas? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are doors damaged?  Do outer doors prevent pest entrance into production areas? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is ventilation adequate? Are ventilation filters on a cleaning schedule? Are records of service activity kept on file?? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 4.3 Utilities | Is the water used in the production processes or equipment cleaning potable at point of use and pose no risk of contamination according to applicable legislation? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are there regular microbiological and chemical tests on water used in the facility (sampled from within the facility)? Frequency based on **risk assessment**? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Does the site have preventative measures to ensure air, compressed air and other gases that come into direct contact with product do not present risk to safety or quality? Do these measures comply with relevant legal regulations? Are filters specifications on file? Is there a PM program for filters? Records of servicing? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 4.5 Layout and product flow | Is a plan of the site available which defines:   * Access points for personnel * Travel routes * Process flow * Storage areas? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is there sufficient working space and storage capacity to enable all operations to be carried out properly under safe and hygienic conditions? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is sorting or activities involving direct handling of the product been undertaken in areas that have the same standards as production areas? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are activities that could pose a contamination risk, such as removal of outer packaging, been carried out in a designated, segregated area? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
|  | Is there a designated walkway to allow access through production areas ensuring adequate segregation from materials? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| 4.6 Equipment | Are Wooden equipment including desks, chairs,  tables, etc properly sealed for effective cleaning? Regular checked to ensure wooden equipment is in good condition and clean? |  |  | . |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is all equipment constructed from suitable materials allowing for cleaning and proper maintenance? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| No temporary repairs using tape / wire / string / cardboard etc at risk to Product Safety. |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| All Temporary Repairs recorded on a Maintenance Job Card and actioned within required time frame? 14 days? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Is newly installed equipment properly specified before purchase?  Tested and Commissioned prior to use?  Maintenance and cleaning programme established? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
| Are notices on equipment cleanable and secure to prevent the likelihood of physical contamination? |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |  |
